Package com.bewsoftware.utils.io

Class ConsoleIO

java.lang.Object
com.bewsoftware.utils.io.ConsoleIO
All Implemented Interfaces:
Display, Exceptions, Input, Closeable, AutoCloseable
public final class ConsoleIO extends Object implements Display, Input
This class implements a console with benefits.

Apart from writing to and reading from the console, you can also write to a file.

Implementation Note:
Once the ConsolIO object is closed, any further calls to any of the methods: append, appendln, print, println, flush, newScanner, readLine, or readPassword, will cause an IOException.
Since:
1.0.7
Version:
2.1.0
Author:
Bradley Willcott

  • Constructor Details

    • ConsoleIO

      private ConsoleIO()
      Instantiates a "blank console".

      All output is thrown away.

      For use by factory method.

    • ConsoleIO

      private ConsoleIO(String linePrefix)
      Instantiates a fully configured "console display".

      All output goes to the system console.

      For use by factory method.

      Parameters:
      linePrefix - text to prepend to each line

    • ConsoleIO

      private ConsoleIO(String linePrefix, String filename, boolean withConsole)
      Instantiates a type of display based on the parameters: filename and withConsole.
      Implementation Requirements:
      If filename is not null and not isBlank(), then the file will be opened/created. If the file exists, it will be truncated. If successful, a copy of all text will be appended to this file.

      If withConsole is true, then the System console will be sent a copy of all text.

      For use by factory method.

      Parameters:
      linePrefix - text to prepend to each line
      filename - the file to output to
      withConsole - whether or not to output to the console, if any

    • readLine

      public String readLine(String fmt, Object... args)
      Description copied from interface: Input
      Provides a formatted prompt, then reads a single line of text from the console.
      Specified by:
      readLine in interface Input
      Parameters:
      fmt - A format string as described in Format string syntax.
      args - Arguments referenced by the format specifiers in the format string. If there are more arguments than format specifiers, the extra arguments are ignored.
      Returns:
      A string containing the line read from the console, not including any line-termination characters, or null if an end of stream has been reached.

    • readPassword

      public char[] readPassword()
      Description copied from interface: Input
      Reads a password or passphrase from the console with echoing disabled.
      Specified by:
      readPassword in interface Input
      Returns:
      A character array containing the password or passphrase read from the console, not including any line-termination characters, or null if an end of stream has been reached.

    • readPassword

      public char[] readPassword(String fmt, Object... args)
      Description copied from interface: Input
      Provides a formatted prompt, then reads a password or passphrase from the console with echoing disabled.
      Specified by:
      readPassword in interface Input
      Parameters:
      fmt - A format string as described in Format string syntax for the prompt text.
      args - Arguments referenced by the format specifiers in the format string. If there are more arguments than format specifiers, the extra arguments are ignored.
      Returns:
      A character array containing the password or passphrase read from the console, not including any line-termination characters, or null if an end of stream has been reached.
